channel.title: Company News
channel.description: Check out most recent news about our company, events, trading condtions & more.

item.title: Changes to XRP trading terms
item.dc:creator: Kyle Martin
item.description: Due to the recent U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's filing against the company behind XRP, we are suspending the opening of position in the coin.
item.content:encoded:
Dear Clients,

 

In light of the recent U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's filing against Ripple Labs Inc, the company behind XRP token, we have seen numerous leading cryptocurrency trading venues are suspending the ability to trade XRP tokens. 

In response to increased uncertainty regarding the continuity of XRP as a cryptocurrency, and decisions of key market participants beyond our control, we have decided to make the following changes to the trading terms of our CFDs on XRPUSD, XRPEUR and XRPBTC:

  1. Effective January 13th, 2021, all aforementioned XRP instruments trade in close-only mode. All clients on all account types will not be able to open a new trade or increase their existing open positions in these instruments. 
  2. On January 29th, 2021 between 16.00-17.00 EET (our MetaTrader time zone) we will force the closure of any remaining open positions in XRPUSD, XRPEUR, and  XRPBTC CFDs at prevailing market prices as quoted in our trading platform.

Please note that due to worsening liquidity conditions, we reserve the right to initiate a close out of remaining open positions on any date, including or before January 29th. 

We remind you all that during anxious market conditions, trading affected instruments involves an increased level of risk. Including the risk, there is also a higher probability to encounter:

  • Significantly higher spreads in affected instruments,
  • Inability to obtain live market price information and to timely update accrued profits and losses on open positions.
  • Longer order execution times and a higher rate of order rejects,
  • Risk of orders being executed at worse prices (slippage), and 
  • Increased holding costs applicable to positions left overnight.

We will closely follow the unfolding situation and continue to adapt accordingly. 

Best to our knowledge and according to public information available to us, no other Digital Currency we offer as a CFD instrument is subject to any similar regulatory actions which could significantly affect its trading conditions.

 

Kind regards, 

Admiral Markets

item.title: Brexit and the Admiral Markets UK Ltd Trading Account
item.dc:creator: Kyle Martin
item.description: As the transitional period ends for Brexit, there may be some very minor changes to certain terms as different regulatory bodies assume authority.
item.content:encoded:
Dear traders,

 

The transitional period for Brexit ended December 31, 2020, and on January 1, 2021, the United Kingdom officially left the European Union. Brokers such as Admiral Markets UK Ltd and its clients are affected by the change in rules and operations.

What are the changes for European clients' trading accounts with Admiral Markets UK Ltd?

For as long as there are no agreements between the UK and the European Union regarding UK-based financial companies, nor any regulatory changes from the EU, European clients can continue to freely use Admiral Markets UK Ltd’s services.

Customers with an existing live account can continue to trade with Admiral Markets UK Ltd as before Brexit, in compliance with current FCA regulations.

Customers who want to open an account with us can open a trading or securities account with Admiral Markets UK Ltd by following the standard procedure, as before Brexit, per their own initiative.

Protection of Client Funds

Since Brexit, Admiral Markets UK Ltd clients are no longer covered by European guarantees from ESMA, but protected under the rules of the Financial Conduct Authority.

FCA fund protection is £85,000 and replaces the €100,000 fund protection in the event of bank failure in the European Union.

Trading conditions

The Admiral Markets Group made the choice, long before Brexit, to standardise its trading conditions within all of the group's entities.

Because of this, there will be no changes in the trading conditions. You will be able to continue trading with our ultra-competitive spreads down to 0.8 for the DAX30 and 0.6 for the EUR/USD, enjoy super-fast execution and all the other advantages of Admiral Markets.

FAQ

Will my trading account be closed?

NO, your account will remain open until the EU, or financial regulatory body, announces otherwise.

Can I open a new trading account?

YES, you can become a customer and open an account or open a second account if you are already a customer.

What is changing in terms of guarantees?

The Customer Deposit Guarantee and Compensation Fund (FSCS) is £85,000.

What is changing about deposits and withdrawals?

The fees for deposits and withdrawals remain exactly the same as before Brexit.

Are the conditions for becoming a professional trader the same?

Yes, the conditions for accessing the status of professional trader are identical.

Will negative balance protection still work?

Yes, the Admiral Markets Group protects all of its retail clients against negative balance under all European and UK group entities.

Can I choose to trade with Admiral Markets under European Union regulation?

Yes, you are free to choose the Admiral Markets entity you wish to trade with. You can select it at the top left of your Trader Space.

 

Best regards,

Admiral Markets

item.title: Brexit and the Admiral Markets Cyprus Ltd Trading Account
item.dc:creator: Kyle Martin
item.description: As the transitional period ends for Brexit, there may be some very minor changes to certain terms as different regulatory bodies assume authority.
item.content:encoded:
Dear traders,

 

The transitional period for Brexit ended December 31, 2020, and on January 1, 2021, the United Kingdom officially left the European Union. As a global broker, the Admiral Markets Group has long had a regulated entity within the European Union.

Open an Admiral Markets Cyprus Ltd account

All European clients can freely choose to open a trading account with Admiral Markets Cyprus Ltd.

What are the Guarantees when trading with Admiral Markets Cyprus Ltd?

Admiral Markets Cyprus is a European broker regulated in Cyprus, as such our clients are protected by the rules of CySEC and ESMA (European Authority of Financial Markets). 

Retail customers are protected against a negative balance without an amount limit, and professional customers are protected against a negative balance up to the limit of €50,000 per customer, in accordance with our negative account balance protection policy.

Protection of Client Funds

Fund protection for Admiral Markets Cyprus Ltd clients is provided by the Investor Compensation Fund. Fund compensation can be up to €20,000 per covered client.

Trading conditions

The Admiral Markets Group made the choice, long before Brexit, to standardise its trading conditions within all of the group's entities.

Because of this, there will be no changes in the trading conditions. You will be able to continue trading with our ultra-competitive spreads down to 0.8 for the DAX30 and 0.6 for the EUR/USD, enjoy super-fast execution and all the other advantages of Admiral Markets.

FAQ

Can I transfer funds from another Admiral Markets entity to my Admiral Markets Cyprus Ltd trading account?

Yes, all you need to do is open an Admiral Markets Cyprus Ltd trading account, go to your Trader's Room, select the Transaction tab and select Transfer to Another Company.

Do I have to redo the entire account opening procedure if I am already a client of another Admiral Markets entity?

No, all you have to do is log into your Trader's Room, go to the top left on the “You are trading with” button and select Admiral Markets Cyprus Ltd. Once on the page, just click on open a new real account. Your documents have already been validated when you opened your first account, you will not need to send them back.

What changes in terms of guarantees?

The guarantee for customer deposits and the compensation fund is a maximum of €20,000 per customer.

What is changing about deposits and withdrawals?

The fees for deposits and withdrawals remain exactly the same as before Brexit.

Are the conditions for becoming a professional trader the same?

Yes, the conditions for accessing the status of professional trader are identical.

Will negative balance protection still work?

Yes, the Admiral Markets Group protects all of its retail clients against negative balance under all group entities. Professional clients are protected up to €50,000, in accordance with our negative account balance protection policy.

Can I choose to trade with Admiral Markets under European Union regulation?

Yes, you are free to choose the Admiral Markets entity you wish to trade with. You can select it at the top left of your Trader's Room.

 

Best regards,

Admiral Markets

item.title: Russia Winter Holiday Market Schedule
item.dc:creator: Kyle Martin
item.description: Due to the upcoming Russian public holidays for this December and January, the trading hours available for some instruments have been modified.
item.content:encoded:
Dear traders,

 

Due to upcoming public holidays in Russia, the USD/RUB and the EUR/RUB will be unavailable December 31, January 1, and January 7.

 

Kind regards,

Admiral Markets

Download it for FREE today by clicking the banner below!â€‹

item.title: Changes to cryptocurrency CFD trading terms
item.dc:creator: Kyle Martin
item.description: The FCA recently announced Policy PS20/10, which prohibits the sale of cryptocurrency derivatives to Retail investors in or from the UK effective January 6
item.content:encoded:
Dear Traders, 

 

Despite major cryptocurrencies emerging as a major part of global financial newsfeeds, the asset class is still in its early stage of becoming mainstream in the investment world. During this time, financial authorities of different countries often take differing regulatory approaches to address the opportunities and risks in the wider use of digital currencies. 

We are writing to let you know that the United Kingdom’s Financial Conduct Authority recently announced Policy PS20/10, which prohibits the sale of cryptocurrency derivatives to Retail investors in or from the UK effective January 6, 2021. 

How does this new FCA policy affect your trades?

As a UK financial services firm, Admiral Markets UK Ltd must comply with this new regulation. 

If you are a Retail client, regardless of your country of residence, beginning January 4, 2021, your open positions in digital currency CFDs will be switched to close-only mode. After this change, you will not be able to open any new positions, or increase existing positions, in any instruments from this group. 

Professional clients of Admiral Markets UK Ltd are not included in this new policy. If you are registered as a Professional client, nothing will change for you. After the policy will come into effect, you can continue trading CFDs on digital currencies on regular terms.

Are there any other restrictions or required actions?

No. This FCA Policy requires UK investment firms to cease offering crypto CFDs to retail clients. All our clients can still trade over 3000 other CFDs, including commission-free CFDs on stocks, ETFs, indices, commodities, currencies, and bond futures. 

We are ready to help

Do not hesitate to let us know if you need any further information regarding the upcoming changes, or how they could affect the way you use our services.

 

Kind regards,

Admiral Markets

item.title: Announcing the Admiral Markets Card - A new way to pay
item.dc:creator: Kyle Martin
item.description: Admiral Markets is excited to announce the groundbreaking new Admiral Markets Card, so you can take charge of your Traderâ€™s Room account like never before!
item.content:encoded:
Dear traders,

 

Admiral Markets is excited to announce the groundbreaking new Admiral Markets Card. 

With this card, which comes in both physical* and virtual forms, you can take charge of your Trader’s Room account like never before. Seamlessly and instantly put your account wallet’s funds to work with a simple, all-in-one service.

The virtual card is free and available to everyone with a live account, the quick and easy application is now on your Trader’s Room Dashboard, and the physical card is available for just 10 Euro. Transfer funds from your wallet to your card with just a few clicks, and spend your returns any way you wish. From online shopping to cash withdrawals at ATMs, never before have your returns been so accessible.

From the markets to your pocket, apply for the Admiral Markets Card today.

 

Kind regards,

Admiral Markets



*Physical card to be available February 2021

From the markets to your pocket, apply for the Admiral Markets Card today.

item.title: Get ready for todayâ€™s Airbnb IPO!
item.dc:creator: Tatjana Zbanova
item.description: Admiral Markets is excited to share that we are now offering the ability to invest in Airbnb shares via our Invest.MT5 account!
item.content:encoded:
On Thursday, December 10, 2020, Airbnb is launching their IPO.


Not familiar with Airbnb? Here are the highlights:

Airbnb, Inc (ABNB.US) is an American online rental marketplace service based in San Francisco, California. Airbnb has had major success since its launch in 2008, and quickly become one of the travel industry's dominant players.

Airbnb offers arrangements for lodging, primarily homestays, or tourism experiences. The company does not own real estate listings, it acts as a broker and receives commissions from each booking. Airbnb is available in more than 81,000 cities and 191 countries worldwide and is targeting a $42 billion USD valuation, making the Airbnb IPO date a highly anticipated event.


How can you take part in the event?

We're excited to share that Admiral Markets has added Airbnb Inc Class A shares to our Invest.MT5 account offering and are immediately available for investment to all Admiral Markets clients with Invest.MT5 accounts.

With Invest.MT5, traders can access thousands of shares and ETFs from 15 of the world's largest stock exchanges, all from MetaTrader 5.

Why invest via Invest.MT5?

  • Open an account with just â‚¬1 and invest from just $0.02 per share with minimum transaction fees of just $1 on US stocks.
  • Receive free real-time market data, with no delays, at no extra cost.
  • Create a stream of passive income by collecting dividend payouts.
  • Use the world-renowned MetaTrader 5 multi-asset class trading platform.

Simply log in to Trader's Room and apply for an Invest.MT5 account to get started.


The content of this communication is not investment advice and does not constitute any offer or solicitation to offer or recommendation of any investment product. It is for general purposes only and does not take into account your individual needs, investment objectives, and specific financial circumstances. Investment involves risk.

item.title: Be prepared for the DoorDash IPO today!
item.dc:creator: Tatjana Zbanova
item.description: Admiral Markets is excited to share that we are now offering the ability to invest in DoorDash shares via our Invest.MT5 account!
item.content:encoded:
On Wednesday, December 09, 2020, DoorDash is launching their IPO.


Not familiar with DoorDash? Here are the highlights:

DoorDash Inc (DASH.US) is a food delivery service. DoorDash connects people with the best feed in their cities by empowering local businesses and generating new ways for people to earn, work, and live. The company is based out of Palo Alto, California, and offers service to over 340,000 stores across the US, Canada, and Australia. The company is seeking a valuation between $23.8 billion to $27.0 billion USD, and the eyes of the market is on the DoorDash IPO.

How can you take part in the event?

We're excited to share that Admiral Markets has added DoorDash Inc shares to our Invest.MT5 account offering and are immediately available for investment to all Admiral Markets clients with Invest.MT5 accounts.
